aboutanime: Anime is hand-drawn and computer-generated animation originating from Japan.
The earliest commercial Japanese animations date to 1917, and the medium has since evolved into a diverse form of storytelling.
Anime is characterized by its unique production methods and vibrant artistic styles.
The industry consists of over 430 production companies, including major studios known for producing iconic works.
Shonen, Shojo, Seinen, Josei, Mecha, Fantasy, Slice of Life, Horror, and more.
Many anime series are adapted from manga, which are Japanese comic books or graphic novels.
Manga serves as a rich source of material, and fans often enjoy both the animated and printed formats.
Over the years, anime has gained immense popularity worldwide.
Iconic series like 'Naruto,' 'Dragon Ball,' and 'One Piece' have a massive international fan base.
The global impact of anime is evident in the growing number of fans, conventions, and merchandise.
